solution_line_template: The hairstylist earns ${price_normal} x {num_normal} = $<<{price_normal}*{num_normal}={normal_per_day}>>{normal_per_day} for a normal haircut per day.
He earns ${price_special} x {num_special} = $<<{price_special}*{num_special}={special_per_day}>>{special_per_day} for a special haircut.
And he earns ${price_trendy} x {num_trendy} = $<<{price_trendy}*{num_trendy}={trendy_per_day}>>{trendy_per_day} for a trendy haircut.
So, the total amount he earns per day is ${normal_per_day} + ${special_per_day} + ${trendy_per_day} = $<<{normal_per_day}+{special_per_day}+{trendy_per_day}={total_per_day}>>{total_per_day}.
Therefore, a hairstylist earns ${total_per_day} x {days_per_week}= $<<{total_per_day}*{days_per_week}={total_per_week}>>{total_per_week} per month.
